_5.description:
Customize the textual description the debugger shows for objects (local variables, etc...). Samples:
      1. this.toString() // will call toString to print all objects
      2. this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : defaultValue // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue
      3. function (def) { return this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : def } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue
_5.patternErrorMessage: 'env.', 'config.' and 'command.' are deprecated, use 'env:', 'config:' and 'command:' instead.

_6.description:
Customize the properties shown for an object in the debugger (local variables, etc...). Samples:
    1. { ...this, extraProperty: '12345' } // Add an extraProperty 12345 to all objects
    2. this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this // Use customProperties method if available, if not use the properties in this (the default properties)
    3. function () { return this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return the default properties

    Deprecated: This is a temporary implementation of this feature until we have time to implement it in the way described here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/102181
_6.patternErrorMessage: 'env.', 'config.' and 'command.' are deprecated, use 'env:', 'config:' and 'command:' instead.

_44.description: If set, attaches to the process via the given port. This is generally no longer necessary for Node.js programs and loses the ability to debug child processes, but can be useful in more esoteric scenarios such as with Deno and Docker launches. If set to 0, a random port will be chosen and --inspect-brk added to the launch arguments automatically.

_46.description: Enable experimental inspection in Node.js. When set to `auto` this is enabled for versions of Node.js that support it. It can be set to `on` or `off` to enable or disable it explicitly.
_46.patternErrorMessage: 'env.', 'config.' and 'command.' are deprecated, use 'env:', 'config:' and 'command:' instead.

_47.markdownDescription:
Configures how debug processes are killed when stopping the session. Can be:

- forceful (default): forcefully tears down the process tree. Sends SIGKILL on posix, or `taskkill.exe /F` on Windows.
- polite: gracefully tears down the process tree. It's possible that misbehaving processes continue to run after shutdown in this way. Sends SIGTERM on posix, or `taskkill.exe` with no `/F` (force) flag on Windows.
- none: no termination will happen.

_62.markdownDescription: Chrome launch options used when attaching to the renderer process, with `debugWebviews` or `debugWebWorkerHost`.

address.description: IP address or hostname the debugged browser is listening on.

browserAttachLocation.description: Forces the browser to attach in one location. In a remote workspace (through ssh or WSL, for example) this can be used to attach to a browser on the remote machine rather than locally.

disableNetworkCache.description: Controls whether to skip the network cache for each request

inspectUri.description:
Format to use to rewrite the inspectUri: It's a template string that interpolates keys in `{curlyBraces}`. Available keys are:
 - `url.*` is the parsed address of the running application. For instance, `{url.port}`, `{url.hostname}`
 - `port` is the debug port that Chrome is listening on.
 - `browserInspectUri` is the inspector URI on the launched browser
 - `browserInspectUriPath` is the path part of the inspector URI on the launched browser (e.g.: "/devtools/browser/e9ec0098-306e-472a-8133-5e42488929c2").
 - `wsProtocol` is the hinted websocket protocol. This is set to `wss` if the original URL is `https`, or `ws` otherwise.

pathMapping.description: A mapping of URLs/paths to local folders, to resolve scripts in the Browser to scripts on disk

perScriptSourcemaps.description: Whether scripts are loaded individually with unique sourcemaps containing the basename of the source file. This can be set to optimize sourcemap handling when dealing with lots of small scripts. If set to "auto", we'll detect known cases where this is appropriate.

port.description: Port to use to remote debugging the browser, given as `--remote-debugging-port` when launching the browser.

resolveSourceMapLocations.description: A list of minimatch patterns for locations (folders and URLs) in which source maps can be used to resolve local files. This can be used to avoid incorrectly breaking in external source mapped code. Patterns can be prefixed with "!" to exclude them. May be set to an empty array or null to avoid restriction.

restart.markdownDescription: Whether to reconnect if the browser connection is closed

targetSelection.markdownDescription: Whether to attach to all targets that match the URL filter ("automatic") or ask to pick one ("pick").

url.description: Will search for a tab with this exact url and attach to it, if found

urlFilter.description: Will search for a page with this url and attach to it, if found. Can have * wildcards.

vueComponentPaths.description: A list of file glob patterns to find `*.vue` components. By default, searches the entire workspace. This needs to be specified due to extra lookups that Vue's sourcemaps require in Vue CLI 4. You can disable this special handling by setting this to an empty array.

webRoot.description: This specifies the workspace absolute path to the webserver root. Used to resolve paths like `/app.js` to files on disk. Shorthand for a pathMapping for "/"

_91.description: Port for the browser to listen on. Defaults to "0", which will cause the browser to be debugged via pipes, which is generally more secure and should be chosen unless you need to attach to the browser from another tool.

_95.description: By default, the browser is launched with a separate user profile in a temp folder. Use this option to override it. Set to false to launch with your default user profile. A new browser can't be launched if an instance is already running from `userDataDir`.

_104.description: Presentation options on how to show this configuration in the debug configuration dropdown and the command palette.

hidden.description: Controls if this configuration should be shown in the configuration dropdown and the command palette.

group.description: Group that this configuration belongs to. Used for grouping and sorting in the configuration dropdown and the command palette.

order.description: Order of this configuration within a group. Used for grouping and sorting in the configuration dropdown and the command palette.

_105.description: The input's id is used to associate an input with a variable of the form ${input:id}.

_106.description: The description is shown when the user is prompted for input.

_107.description: The default value for the input.

args.description: Command line arguments to pass to the grunt task

file.description: The Grunt file that provides the task. Can be omitted.
The Gulp file that provides the task. Can be omitted.
The Jake file that provides the task. Can be omitted.

path.description: The path to the folder of the package.json file that provides the script. Can be omitted.

tsconfig.description: The tsconfig file that defines the TS build.

_121.description: Time until value evaluation for hovered symbols is aborted. If set to 0, hover evaluation does never time out.

_122.description: Extra time in milliseconds allowed per session to be spent waiting for source-maps to be processed, after the minimum time (sourceMapMinPause) has been exhausted

_123.description: Minimum time in milliseconds spent waiting for each source-map to be processed when a script is being parsed

_124.description: Trace may be set to 'true' to write diagnostic logs to the disk.

logFile.description: Configures where on disk logs are written.

stdio.description: Whether to return trace data from the launched application or browser.

_126.markdownDescription: Server is ready if this pattern appears on the debug console. The first capture group must include a URI or a port number.

_127.markdownDescription: A format string used when constructing the URI from a port number. The first '%s' is substituted with the port number.

_128.markdownDescription: Stop the child session when the parent session stopped.

_129.markdownDescription: What to do with the URI when the server is ready.

_131.description: A list of debug sessions which, when this debug session is terminated, will also be stopped.

_132.description:
Customize the textual description the debugger shows for objects (local variables, etc...). Samples:
      1. this.toString() // will call toString to print all objects
      2. this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : defaultValue // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue
      3. function (def) { return this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : def } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue

_133.description:
Customize the properties shown for an object in the debugger (local variables, etc...). Samples:
    1. { ...this, extraProperty: '12345' } // Add an extraProperty 12345 to all objects
    2. this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this // Use customProperties method if available, if not use the properties in this (the default properties)
    3. function () { return this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return the default properties

    Deprecated: This is a temporary implementation of this feature until we have time to implement it in the way described here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/102181

_134.description: Toggles whether we verify the contents of files on disk match the ones loaded in the runtime. This is useful in a variety of scenarios and required in some, but can cause issues if you have server-side transformation of scripts, for example.

_135.markdownDescription: Toggles whether the debugger will try to read DWARF debug symbols from WebAssembly, which can be resource intensive. Requires the `ms-vscode.wasm-dwarf-debugging` extension to function.

_136.description: If source maps are enabled, these glob patterns specify the generated JavaScript files. If a pattern starts with `!` the files are excluded. If not specified, the generated code is expected in the same directory as its source.

_137.markdownDescription: From where to capture output messages: the default debug API if set to `console`, or stdout/stderr streams if set to `std`.

_138.markdownDescription: Whether to wait for source maps to load for each incoming script. This has a performance overhead, and might be safely disabled when running off of disk, so long as `rootPath` is not disabled.

_139.description: Configures a web server to start up. Takes the same configuration as the 'node' launch task.

args.description:
Command line arguments passed to the program.

Can be an array of strings or a single string. When the program is launched in a terminal, setting this property to a single string will result in the arguments not being escaped for the shell.

attachSimplePort.description: If set, attaches to the process via the given port. This is generally no longer necessary for Node.js programs and loses the ability to debug child processes, but can be useful in more esoteric scenarios such as with Deno and Docker launches. If set to 0, a random port will be chosen and --inspect-brk added to the launch arguments automatically.

console.description: Where to launch the debug target.
enumDescriptions: VS Code Debug Console (which doesn't support to read input from a program)
External terminal that can be configured via user settings

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. If you've set localRoot then cwd will match that value otherwise it falls back to your workspaceFolder

experimentalNetworking.description: Enable experimental inspection in Node.js. When set to `auto` this is enabled for versions of Node.js that support it. It can be set to `on` or `off` to enable or disable it explicitly.

killBehavior.markdownDescription:
Configures how debug processes are killed when stopping the session. Can be:

- forceful (default): forcefully tears down the process tree. Sends SIGKILL on posix, or `taskkill.exe /F` on Windows.
- polite: gracefully tears down the process tree. It's possible that misbehaving processes continue to run after shutdown in this way. Sends SIGTERM on posix, or `taskkill.exe` with no `/F` (force) flag on Windows.
- none: no termination will happen.

profileStartup.description: If true, will start profiling as soon as the process launches

program.description: Absolute path to the program. Generated value is guessed by looking at package.json and opened files. Edit this attribute.

restart.description: Try to reconnect to the program if we lose connection. If set to `true`, we'll try once a second, forever. You can customize the interval and maximum number of attempts by specifying the `delay` and `maxAttempts` in an object instead.

runtimeArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the runtime executable.

runtimeExecutable.markdownDescription: Runtime to use. Either an absolute path or the name of a runtime available on the PATH. If omitted `node` is assumed.

runtimeVersion.markdownDescription: Version of `node` runtime to use. Requires `nvm`.

command.description: Command to run in the launched terminal. If not provided, the terminal will open without launching a program.

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. If you've set localRoot then cwd will match that value otherwise it falls back to your workspaceFolder

_141.description: Show the async calls that led to the current call stack.

_142.description: An array of file or folder names, or path globs, to skip when debugging. Star patterns and negations are allowed, for example, `["**/node_modules/**", "!**/node_modules/my-module/**"]`

_143.description: Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.

_144.description: A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk.

_145.description: Whether to use the "names" mapping in sourcemaps. This requires requesting source content, which can be slow with certain debuggers.

_146.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

_147.description: Retry for this number of milliseconds to connect to Node.js. Default is 10000 ms.

_149.description: Configures what diagnostic output is produced.

_151.description: Attach debugger to new child processes automatically.

_152.markdownDescription: Environment variables passed to the program. The value `null` removes the variable from the environment.

_153.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.

_154.description: Path to the local directory containing the program.

_155.description: Allows you to explicitly specify the Node version that's running, which can be used to disable or enable certain behaviors in cases where the automatic version detection does not work.

_156.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program.

_157.description: A list of minimatch patterns for locations (folders and URLs) in which source maps can be used to resolve local files. This can be used to avoid incorrectly breaking in external source mapped code. Patterns can be prefixed with "!" to exclude them. May be set to an empty array or null to avoid restriction.

_158.markdownDescription: A list of patterns at which to manually insert entrypoint breakpoints. This can be useful to give the debugger an opportunity to set breakpoints when using sourcemaps that don't exist or can't be detected before launch, such as [with the Serverless framework](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-js-debug/issues/492).
